introduction: 'For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them.' - Aristotle</br></br>Welcome to Machine Dynamics & Mechanical Vibrations Lab!!</br>Click on 'Experiments' to see the list of experiments available. Feel free to explore the lab.

experiments.name: Free vibration of simply supported beam

UG: B.E/ B.Tech Mechanical Engineering, Field of Acoustics

objective: After completing every simulation experiment in the Machine Dynamics Mechanical Vibration lab students can be able to</br></br>1. Find the stiffness and critical damping of the system.</br>2. Calculate the damping coefficient, logarithmic decrement, damping ratio, damping frequency, and natural frequency of the system.</br>3. Learn the effect of damping in forced vibration of a single degree of freedom due to forces.</br>4. Understand the application of force excitation on two degrees of freedom spring-mass system.</br>5. Find how to set secondary mass parameters in order to absorb primary mass vibration.
